basics.description: Mannai's one-click-to-deploy customer package. Complete the parameters below of where you would like Microsoft Sentinel to reside, and which data connectors to deploy, and you're done!

options.text: Enter a resource group name to be used. Please ensure this value is unique before creating the resource group and Azure resources. If an existing Sentinel workspace will be used for the MDR service, enter the Resource group name containing it.

basics.name: rgName
basics.label: Resource Group name
basics.toolTip: Enter a resource group name to be used. Please ensure this value is unique before creating the resource group and Azure resources. If an existing Sentinel workspace will be used for the MDR service, enter the Resource group name containing it.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

options.text: Resource group and Sentinel workspace names must be unique to prevent operational conflicts. Do not proceed if unsure and contact a Mannai engineer.

elements.name: existingWorkspaceSection
elements.label: Here you can select an existing Log Analytics workspace. If Sentinel has not been enabled on this workspace, it will be enabled.

options.text: To create a new workspace, do no select an existing resource.

elements.name: laWorkspaceSelector
elements.label: Select existing Log Analytics workspace

elements.name: newWorkspaceSection
elements.label: Or, enter the name for a new Sentinel workspace to be created.

options.text: If an existing workspace is selected above, this value will be ignored.

elements.name: workspaceName
elements.label: Enter the name of a new Workspace to be created.
elements.toolTip: The Workspace name should include 4-63 letters, digits or '-'. The '-' shouldn't be the first or the last symbol. If this value is provided, existing workspaces will be omitted and new Log Analytics and Sentinel workspaces will be created. Sentinel workspace names must be unique to prevent operational conflicts. Do not proceed if unsure and contact a Mannai engineer.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and '-' are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long. First and last characters must be alphanumeric.

options.text: Resource group and Sentinel workspace names must be unique to prevent operational conflicts. Do not proceed if unsure and contact a Mannai engineer.

elements.name: workspaceDetails
elements.label: Sentinel workspace details

options.text: You can configure a daily cap and limit the daily ingestion for your workspace. This setting must be used carefully as it can result in data loss for the rest of the day once the limit is reached, impacting the log collection and detection capabilities.

elements.name: dailyQuota
elements.label: Daily ingestion limit in GBs. Enter 0 for no limit.
elements.toolTip: This limit doesn't apply to the following tables: SecurityAlert, SecurityBaseline, SecurityBaselineSummary, SecurityDetection, SecurityEvent, WindowsFirewall, MaliciousIPCommunication, LinuxAuditLog, SysmonEvent, ProtectionStatus, WindowsEvent

constraints.validationMessage: Only numbers allowed, and the value must be 1-4 characters long.

options.text: Data retention at the workspace level can be configured from 30 to 730 days (2 years) unless the legacy Free pricing tier is in use. Retention for individual data types can also be set to as low as 4 days. To retain data longer than 730 days, consider using Log Analytics workspace data export. Log Analytic workspaces with the Sentinel solution are entitled to 90 days of data retention at no additional cost.

elements.name: retentionSlider
elements.label: Retention in Days

options.text: These values will overwrite existing settings.

elements.name: pricingTier
elements.label: Select pricing tier for Sentinel and Log Analytics
elements.toolTip: Visit [Azure Monitor Pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/monitor/) for more information.

elements.name: capacityReservation
elements.label: Select Commitment Tier for Sentinel and Log Analytics
elements.toolTip: Select the Commitment Tier in GB/day

options.text: Please select which settings you would like to enable in your Microsoft Sentinel environment

elements.name: enableUeba
elements.label: Enable User Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA)? Global Admin or Security Admin permission required.
elements.toolTip: This will only enable synchronization with identity providers. Data sources need to be enabled separately. [Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/identify-threats-with-entity-behavior-analytics)

elements.name: identityProviders
elements.label: Select which Identity Providers will be synchronized with UEBA
elements.toolTip: Select the identity providers that you would like to enable for UEBA

allowedValues.label: Active Directory (requires Microsoft Defender for Identity)

elements.name: enableDiagnostics
elements.label: Enable Sentinel health diagnostics?
elements.toolTip: This will enable diagnostics settings for Analytics rules, Data Connectors and Automation rules. [Learn more](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/health-audit)

options.text: Please select which Solutions you want to install into your Microsoft Sentinel environment. Solutions may contain different content types, like data connectors, analytics rules, parsers, workbooks, playbooks, hunting queries, etc.

elements.name: enableSolutions1P
elements.label: Select Microsoft Content Hub solutions to install
elements.toolTip: Select the Microsoft solutions that you would like to install

allowedValues.label: Azure Active Directory
allowedValues.description: The Azure Active Directory solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables you to ingest Azure Active Directory Audit,Sign-in,Provisioning,Risk Events and Risky User/Service Principal logs using Diagnostic Settings into Microsoft Sentinel.

allowedValues.label: Azure Activity
allowedValues.description: The Azure Activity solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables you to ingest Azure Activity Administrative, Security, Service Health, Alert, Recommendation, Policy, Autoscale and Resource Health logs using Diagnostic Settings into Microsoft Sentinel.

allowedValues.label: Microsoft 365
allowedValues.description: The Microsoft 365 solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables you to ingest operational logs from Microsoft 365 to gain insights into user and admin activity across your collaboration platforms such as Teams, SharePoint and Exchange.

allowedValues.label: Microsoft Defender for Cloud
allowedValues.description: The Microsoft Defender for Cloud solution for Microsoft Sentinel allows you to ingest Security alerts reported in Microsoft Defender for Cloud on assessing your hybrid cloud workload's security posture.

allowedValues.label: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
allowedValues.description: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint is an enterprise endpoint security platform designed to help enterprise networks prevent, detect, investigate, and respond to advanced threats.

allowedValues.label: Threat Intelligence
allowedValues.description: Ingest threat indicators into Microsoft Sentinel. Threat indicators can be IP addresses, domains, URLs and file hashes and can be used to correlate across log sources for known indicators of compromise and/or indicators of active attack

elements.name: enableSolutionsEssentials
elements.label: Select Essentials Content Hub solutions to install
elements.toolTip: Select essentials solutions that you would like to install

allowedValues.label: Attacker Tools Threat Protection Essentials
allowedValues.description: The Attacker Tools Threat Protection Essentials solution contains security content that is relevant for detection of tools commonly used by attackers in various campaigns

allowedValues.label: Cloud Identity Threat Protection Essentials
allowedValues.description: The Cloud Identity Threat Protection Essentials solution looks for most common cloud focused identity attacks such as Suspicious Sign-ins, privilege grants, MFA disable etc.

allowedValues.label: Cloud Service Threat Protection Essentials
allowedValues.description: The Cloud Service Threat Protection Essentials contains security content that is relevant for detection of attacks against various cloud services like key vault, storage, compute etc.

allowedValues.label: Endpoint Threat Protection Essentials
allowedValues.description: The Endpoint Threat Protection Essentials solution provides content to monitor, detect and investigate threats related to windows machines.

allowedValues.label: Network Session Essentials
allowedValues.description: The Network Session Essentials solution leverages the Advanced Security Information Model (ASIM) to correlate insights across 15+ networking data sources and deliver more value for SOC use cases with less content.

allowedValues.label: Network Threat Protection Essentials
allowedValues.description: The Network Threat Protection Essentials solution contains queries that identifies suspicious network behavior based on various data sources ingested in Sentinel.

allowedValues.label: SOC Handbook
allowedValues.description: The SOC Handbook solution for Microsoft Sentinel provides a collection of resources that enable and empower SOC Analysts to get better visibility and understanding of point-in-time security posture of organizational resources.

allowedValues.label: SOC Process Framework
allowedValues.description: The SOC Process Framework Solution is built in order to easily integrate with Microsoft Sentinel and build a standard SOC Process and Procedure Framework within your Organization.

allowedValues.label: UEBA Essentials
allowedValues.description: The Sentinel UEBA content package will provide you with various queries based on UEBA tables, that allows you to hunt for tailored threat scenarios.

elements.name: enableSolutionsTraining
elements.label: Select Training and Tutorials Content Hub solutions to install
elements.toolTip: Select the training and tutorials solutions that you would like to install

allowedValues.label: KQL Training
allowedValues.description: The KQL Training solution for Microsoft Sentinel contains resources that can help up â€“ skill on understanding the fundamentals and using KQL in advanced scenarios like authoring effective and optimized queries used in Sentinel Analytics, Hunting Queries, Workbooks, etc.

allowedValues.label: Training Lab
allowedValues.description: Microsoft Sentinel Training Lab helps you get ramped up with Microsoft Sentinel providing hands-on practical experience for product features, capabilities, and scenarios.

options.text: Please select which Data Connectors you would like to configure in your Microsoft Sentinel environment

elements.name: enableDataConnectors
elements.label: Select data connectors to onboard
elements.toolTip: Select the data connectors that you would like to enable

allowedValues.label: Azure Active Directory
allowedValues.description: Relevant license and Global Admin or Security Admin permission required.

allowedValues.label: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection
allowedValues.description: Relevant license and Global Admin or Security Admin permission required.

allowedValues.label: Azure Activity
allowedValues.description: This will only bring logs from the subscription selected in Basics tab. Relevant permissions at the subscription level are required.

allowedValues.label: Microsoft 365 Defender
allowedValues.description: This will only enable incident and alert synchronization, no advanced hunting data will be enabled. Relevant license and Global Admin or Security Admin permission required

allowedValues.label: Microsoft Defender for Cloud
allowedValues.description: Security Reader permission required

allowedValues.label: Office 365
allowedValues.description: Relevant license and Global Admin or Security Admin permission required

allowedValues.label: Threat Intelligence Platforms
allowedValues.description: Global Admin or Security Admin permission required

elements.name: aadStreams
elements.label: Select Azure Active Directory log types to enable
elements.toolTip: Select Azure Active Directory log types you would like to stream to the workspace

options.text: Please select which analytics rules you would like to enable in your Microsoft Sentinel environment

elements.name: enableMLAlerts
elements.label: Enable ML Behavior Analytics alert rules?
elements.toolTip: Select to enable ML Behavior Analytics rules for selected connectors (SecurityEvents and/or Syslog)

constraints.validationMessage: Enables SSH and/or RDP anomalous login alerts

elements.name: enableScheduledAlerts
elements.label: Enable Scheduled alert rules for selected Content Hub solutions and Data Connectors?
elements.toolTip: Select to enable Scheduled and NRT analytics rules for the solutions and connectors selected in the previous tabs

constraints.validationMessage: Enables Scheduled and NRT rules matching any of the selected solutions and connectors

elements.name: severityLevels
elements.label: Select the severity of the rules to enable
elements.toolTip: Select the data connectors that you would like to enable
